projects.title: SipSafe
projects.shortDescription: HackViolet 2026: IoT drink safety system
projects.description: Built a cross-platform IoT solution at HackViolet 2026 to protect beverages from tampering. The system combines an ESP32 device with capacitive touch sensing to detect when a drink's lid is removed, paired with native iOS (SwiftUI) and Android (Kotlin/Compose) mobile apps. When the device detects tampering while armed, it triggers a local buzzer alarm, BLE notification to the paired phone, and automated push notifications plus SMS alerts to emergency contacts via Supabase edge functions. Implemented a custom BLE GATT service for communication between the ESP32 and mobile apps, with offline event queuing so nothing is missed if the phone temporarily disconnects.

projects.title: WikiArena
projects.shortDescription: LMArena for Online Encyclopedias
projects.description: Built an open-source platform that applies competitive ranking to online encyclopedias, answering the question: do people actually prefer AI-generated encyclopedias like Grokipedia over traditional sources like Wikipedia or Britannica? Users are presented with blind side-by-side comparisons of articles from different sources on the same topic, and their votes feed into a Glicko-2 rating system (the same algorithm used in chess rankings) to produce a real-time leaderboard. Also built a Knowledge Blender feature that uses xAI's Grok to synthesize the best parts of multiple sources into a single article. The platform currently integrates five sources: Wikipedia, Grokipedia, Encyclopedia Britannica, Citizendium, and New World Encyclopedia. Separated the Selenium-based web scraping into its own Dockerized backend service to keep the main app lightweight.

projects.title: Orbit
projects.shortDescription: Project management meets performance-based compensation
projects.description: Building a gamified workplace platform that combines project management with performance-based compensation. The core idea is inspired by Andy Grove's management philosophy: capability times motivation equals performance. The platform supports multiple roles including sales, project managers, QC reviewers, employees, and contractors, each with their own views and workflows. Features include a Kanban task board with urgency multipliers, customizable salary structures mixing base pay with task-based compensation, AI-assisted quality control with Shapley value-based payouts, and auto-generated contracts with e-signatures. Built the ML pipeline (OrbitQCML) to predict first-pass QC approval probability using GitHub PR data with a Random Forest classifier and FastAPI inference endpoint. Also ran Monte Carlo simulations (Orbit-MonteCarlo) to optimize the confidence-scaling and geometric decay parameters for the QC payout system.

projects.title: Archimedes Snipe Bot
projects.shortDescription: Discord Bot for 'Sniping'
projects.description: Built a discord bot for 'sniping', where members take pictures of each other without the other noticing, which is used as a general team building activity for the semester. The bot notes the quantity of snipes and provides information like a leaderboard and rules. This as built specifically for Archimedes, but could be applied to any club or community in discord since it was generalized. Simply target a channel, and then it can calculate the totals as needed. This also allows it to be in place, or not be used before, as it does a running calculation and then caches it on each bot restart. This provides a bit of flexibility, and since not a ton of data is being cached, it works fine in comparison to using a database, which would require 100% uptime. I maintain the project and deal with any new features or issues as they arrive

projects.title: HomeLab v1
projects.shortDescription: Started a HomeLab!
projects.description: Grabbed an old laptop I was not using and converted it to run an Ubuntu server. Then setup SSH and some basic security, and now do development remotely on it using VS Code. I also experimented with a lot of self-hosting, namely running my own n8n instance and my own Supabase instance, alongside setting up some quality of life things like Webmin to stay up to date on the server status. Mainly running some containers on it, but also playing around with things like xRDP to try out development setups on the machine inside of containers. I currently mainly use it as a source of compute, where I can do things like train models for my side projects without bogging my everyday laptop down.

projects.title: Archimedes Website
projects.shortDescription: Static Website Project
projects.description: Built out the static website for the Archimedes Society at Virginia Tech, converting it from Squarespace to be a fully custom website on its own. Relatively straightforward, and set up deployments to be through Vercel. Now continuously adding new features into it. To hit the full functionality that was originally on Squarespace, I used things like EmailJS in order to add in features like a contact form. Overall is a relatively simple site in order to get better engagement and publicity within the community and to get better outreach with our sponsors and partners.

projects.title: Second Student
projects.shortDescription: VTHacks13: Canvas LMS Notes
projects.description: The concept behind this project was to build a full-fledged knowledge management system which could accept external integrations such as Canvas LMS in order to integrate notes and task management all into one knowledge base, instead of having to go to multiple platforms. The issue we as students had was the formatting for certain sites like Canvas were not great, and by getting all of the information we interact with on a daily basis into one location, we could improve our workflow. We got a basic version of this working at the hackathon, particularly integrating with Canvas itself, but decided to not continue due to just how complicated making an original note-taking application is, and how much time it would take to even get to an MVP.

projects.title: HTMLToMD
projects.shortDescription: Beginner Scala Project
projects.description: Built out a Scala backend to begin working with Scala, and to work a bit with a concept for VTHacks, which involved converting all of the files we can into native Markdown, which would allow tools like Obsidian or other Markdown knowledge management systems beyond the ones we created to be used. Was overall successful, however did not use for VTHacks13.

projects.title: LUMA
projects.shortDescription: Custom ATS
projects.description: Fully customized fully functional ATS system made for the archimedes society at VT to counter scheduling difficulties and additional requested functionality. Has all the typical features of an ATS alongside a scheduling algorithm built with it to pair up recruiters with applicants. This system is built with cyclic recruiting cycles in mind, not rolling cycles in mind, so it is specialized.

projects.title: Sparkli Dev App
projects.shortDescription: Internal dev app
projects.description: Simple Svelte application to enable internal edits to our database in a simpler frontend. Made it much quicker to edit and creat new date ideas for our database, alongside uploading the proper image and utilizing proper image compression all in one go. Remove the need to manually process or batch process every picture, and just click a few buttons and input some info.

projects.title: Customer Onboarding App
projects.shortDescription: Automated Form Application
projects.description: React application which served as an automated and digital way to onboard new clients at Planes Moving and Storage. Express backend which was hosted on Windows Server 2016 in order to safely store the data and avoid common attacks like SQL injection.

projects.title: Supabase-Flutter Quickstart
projects.shortDescription: Creating a generalized quickstart for Supabase authentication, edge functions, and Flutter.
projects.description: Developed a comprehensive quickstart guide for integrating Supabase authentication and edge functions with Flutter applications. This project aims to streamline the setup process for developers looking to utilize Supabase in their Flutter projects. Particularly, I made it so my personal projects like hackathons have an easy starting point.

projects.title: Portfolio Website Revamp
projects.shortDescription: Personal portfolio website built with SvelteKit, Markdown, mdsvex, and TailwindCSS
projects.description: Created a modern portfolio website using SvelteKit for the framework, Markdown for content management, and TailwindCSS for styling. The site features a clean, responsive design with dark/light theme support and smooth page transitions. Built to showcase my projects and skills in an organized way.

projects.title: SteerClear
projects.shortDescription: Walking at night is dangerous - why not have Waze for walking, using crowdsourced reports?
projects.description: Won 'Best Startup Hack' at Hackviolet. Created SteerClear to address the safety concerns of walking at night, particularly for college students aged 18-24. The app uses crowdsourced data to identify and recommend the safest walking routes, similar to how Waze works for driving. Features include an interactive map with community threat/safety markers, smart route planning, panic button, heat map of reported incidents, group walk system, college selection, and alternate transportation recommendations. Built with Expo React Native and styled with NativeWind, using Supabase for serverless backend and real-time database updates. Integrated MapBox for route visualization, Google Places API for location data, and OpenAI for dynamic threat analysis. The app aims to give everyone peace of mind while walking alone, especially in winter months when it gets dark earlier.

projects.title: Automated Voicemail Transcription
projects.shortDescription: Automated flow to transcribe voicemails.
projects.description: Created a full solution in Azure to take incoming voicemails from Planes and process them all into text so it could be utilized for other projects internally in the organization. Took the input data and output the raw text to Dataverse by utilizing Azure Speech Services.

projects.title: Apple Canada Remittance
projects.shortDescription: Revamp existing apple remittance process for Planes to operate with Apple Canada.
projects.description: Full scale automation process focused on parsing all Apple Canada remittance information to avoid accounting from having to manually read all of the adjustments. Handled automatically receiving the data to an inbox, parsing critical information, and then adding it to central data stores.

projects.title: TrashCash
projects.shortDescription: A mobile app that incentivizes proper waste disposal through gamification and rewards
projects.description: Created a mobile application and IoT device (scanner unit) that encourages recycling by rewarding users with points and achievements. Users can scan waste items, track their environmental impact, and redeem points for rewards. The app includes features like wastebin location finder, points display, and history of items scanned. Built this out with a flutter application, plans for a admin display, an an esp32 scanner unit to go on each bin.

projects.title: RoomReady
projects.shortDescription: VTHacks12: Connect travelers with locals.
projects.description: Flutter application to help travelers get connected with locals. Locals eventually are the travelers, and this exchange of information is important in order for both parties to have the best travel experiences. This app connects them, helps plan trips, alongside other features powered by the collection of data from conversations. Built with Flutter, Supabase, and Amazon EC2.

projects.title: Inflectors Project
projects.shortDescription: Participated in CIA pilot project which involved a series of weekly cryptography puzzles.
projects.description: Completed a total of 10 puzzles, which were a series of weekly cryptography puzzles. All were in-depth and challenging, each one taking multiple hours to complete. Finished within the top ten of the leaderboard, in which points were earned by completing the puzzles and being the quickest to complete them. Learned many cryptography tactics and concepts.

projects.title: Website Creation
projects.shortDescription: Personal portfolio website built with markdown after exploring various website creation tools
projects.description: Played around with a bunch of different options to make the website. Tried out Jekyll, which I did not like, used Weebly on Porkbun to make it no-code (which felt clunky), and considered using Hugo. In the end, I decided to just go with plain old markdown, and maybe add a nicer looking theme at the completion of writing the raw markdown.

projects.title: AdaptiveSpec Logistics
projects.shortDescription: Web scraping tool to enhance specialized logistics.
projects.description: Created a web scraping tool specifically for specialized logistics. Built framework where selected companies were added to a personal/company-wide database, which then pushed those selections to the top of the searches. Did not complete but want to add an ML model to learn through user interaction with the application and push certain traits up further on results, which will end up being a future project.
projects.type: Solo Project in a Team Competition

projects.title: Student Health Tracker
projects.shortDescription: Location based early diagnosis and health education tool.
projects.description: Competing in Microsoft's Imagine Cup. Our team is still in prototyping.

projects.title: Symptom2Disease
projects.shortDescription: ML classifier for symptom-based disease prediction
projects.description: Built a proof-of-concept machine learning pipeline that predicts diseases based on symptom inputs, created as part of Microsoft's Imagine Cup. Trained two models on Kaggle datasets: a Random Forest classifier as the lightweight option and an XGBoost gradient-boosted model for higher accuracy. Set up a simple API endpoint for inference so the models could be integrated into the Student Health Tracker app our team was prototyping.

projects.title: SeeFood
projects.shortDescription: AI-powered cooking assistant with voice commands built in Unity
projects.description: Worked in a team of four to make a tool which was an AI cooking assistant. It provided feedback on a wide variety of inputs, such as cooking time, and if items were spoiled or not. I primarily worked on the UI in Unity and made the dictation tool to enable voice commands, which then communicated with our backend to provide the requested service.

projects.title: Harvard's CS50
projects.shortDescription: Taking Harvard's introductory computer science course to strengthen CS fundamentals
projects.description: Working to strengthen foundational Computer Science concepts. Following along with the phenomenal lectures from David J. Malan and completing the problem sets to earn my CS50 completion certificate. Worked through weekly psets and lectures to overall get a better grasp of the fundamentals of programming.

projects.title: Sprklii MVP
projects.shortDescription: Date ideas, personalized.
projects.description: Founded an LLC with the idea of bringing personalization to the date ideas scene. Google and other competitors serve people very generalized and blank ideas, and we serve personalized and customized ideas to keep the spark alive. I worked as the only developer to get our MVP and alpha product released, and now lead a team with two other developers as we enter our beta phase.

projects.title: Mover's Suite API
projects.shortDescription: Built API connection tools for moving company's management software
projects.description: Created API connection tools for Mover's Suite. These connections enabled continuous data transfer between existing systems, which otherwise was not occurring. This was a great project to work on, and I learned a lot about the inner workings of the software we were using at Planes, and also how to properly work with APIs, even if the documentation is lacking.

projects.title: Mover's Suite RPA Status Updates
projects.shortDescription: Automated status update system for moving company operations
projects.description: Developed automated status update system at Planes Moving and Storage. This was an RPA project where I used Power Automate Desktop to simulate the actions typically required in Mover's Suite to update a status. This project was done because accessing certain things like statuses via the API was extremely difficult, and by using RPA we were able to accomplish a similar effect without using the API. Additionally, this served internally as a demo of the possibilities of RPA in conjunction with some of the legacy systems and software in use.

projects.title: Employee Technology Education
projects.shortDescription: Led technical training initiatives for company employees
projects.description: Led employee training and education initiatives at Planes. Training included multiple different topics, including Application Lifecycle Management, Microsoft Dataverse, Git, GitHub, and SQL Server. This was a part of a larger initiative to move the company to Microsoft's Power Platform. Inside of the group of devs, this was a part of an initiative to move our SCM elsewhere. We were on Visual SourceSafe, and I was instrumental in explaining the basics of Git and GitHub, and helping initiate and bring about our migration to using Git as our SCM.
links: Contact me for the particular presentations.

projects.title: XPM to Smartsheet Data Connection
projects.shortDescription: Created data integration between XPM and Smartsheet.
projects.description: Built data connection between XPM and Smartsheet at Planes. This data integration was integral, as it allowed us to move data between systems that we were unable to prior to this, and it was done as a manual process prior to the implementation of this system. This system also had to interact with data on an exchange drive. Working on this project taught me a lot about how data flows and the importance of data integrity. I also learned a lot about how to work with different systems and groups to integrate something that works across multiple teams and functional groups.

projects.title: Project Manager Time Tracking
projects.shortDescription: Developed mobile-friendly time tracking system to replace legacy system
projects.description: Project Manager Time Tracker was a time tracking system to replace our previous system built into XPM. This project recreated the functionality of the previous system so it could be accessed in mobile form, and we also automated and simplified the process while developing the new application.

projects.title: SmartSheet Supplier Information
projects.shortDescription: Centralized supplier information system with automated data entry
projects.description: Smartsheet Supplier Information was a project to better centralize all of our supplier information in the Microsoft ecosystem. Prior to this project everything was in Smartsheet and scattered across multiple files and sheets. This project centralized all of this information and automated some of the steps in the process of adding information to the database.

projects.title: Apple Remittance Automation
projects.shortDescription: Automated parsing of Apple remittance emails into CSV format
projects.description: This project involved automating the extraction of information from our Apple remittances. Apple sends their remittances as text embedded in email, so I had to write an automation to parse the text and save it into a CSV so our accounting department could more easily work with it. This way accountants did not need to manually compile this data.

projects.title: Warehouse Time Tracking App
projects.shortDescription: Built time tracking application for warehouse operations.
projects.description: Developed warehouse time tracking application at Planes Moving and Storage. This enabled better limits and regulations on data entry, and greatly improved our process for warehouse time entry, and increased the amount of billable time in the warehouse.

projects.title: SOP SharePoint
projects.shortDescription: Created and managed standard operating procedures system in SharePoint
projects.description: Created and managed SOP SharePoint system at Planes Moving and Storage as IT Intern

projects.title: GolfBot MVP
projects.shortDescription: Golf-playing robot for those who are physically impaired. Built for May We Help.
projects.description: Developed a specialized robot capable of playing golf to assist individuals with physical impairments. The robot was built for May We Help, a non-profit organization dedicated to creating custom solutions for people with special needs. The system used computer vision to identify golf balls and targets, and featured a mechanical swing mechanism that could be triggered remotely. This project made the sport of golf more accessible to those who otherwise couldn't participate.

projects.title: FictileBot
projects.shortDescription: Starting point for any robot using the Rev/FTC Robotics Framework
projects.description: Created a template repository that serves as the foundation for any FTC robotics project using the REV Robotics framework. This repository contains all the basic configurations, helper functions, and standard implementations needed to quickly start a new robot project. It was successfully used by Team 4969 as the starting point to create their golf bot, demonstrating its effectiveness as a reusable template.

projects.title: Robot-X Computer Vision
projects.shortDescription: Enhanced robotics vision system using dual-channel input with OpenCV
projects.description: Revamped our vision system using OpenCV. This was a pretty widespread project that I did on my own to implement two channels of input rather than just using a single channel of input. Took a huge portion of competition season to complete, but resulted in extremely accurate vision by comparing the channels of input.

projects.title: Robot-X Software Lead
projects.shortDescription: Led robotics software team for 3 years, implementing agile practices
projects.description: Lead software team at Robot-X for three years, with around three members working for me on the subteam. Worked to introduce agile practices into our workflow, and saw efficiency increases due to it. Got a large amount of experience working as both a PM and working directly on some of the more challenging software we needed to write.
links: All repos are private, some samples are on my GitHub.

projects.title: Automatic Garage Door Closer
projects.shortDescription: Built IoT device to automatically close garage doors using Arduino.
projects.description: Created an automatic garage door closing system that physically pressed the garage door button when the garage door was left open for too long. Used two radio transceivers, an ultrasonic sensor, and a servo to put together the physical product to accompany the software I made.
links: Contact me for the specific files

projects.title: Kids Like Food 2
projects.shortDescription: First programming project - food blog built with HTML/CSS.
projects.description: Learned the basics of HTML and CSS as a starting project to make a food blog with a friend. Used Google Docs as version control and learned fundamental programming practices.
